timeline.bodyText:
These register calls should probably be in onEnable??
Unless I'm missing something, they're currently being added on every PluginEnableEvent? (this is gonna fire every time a plugin loads?!)
timeline.author: lucko

replies.bodyText:
No... I think you're right about that. It is definitely going to fire every time a plugin loads. I actually did originally have these in onEnable, but the problem is that before checkPermissions is run (which is only done here) the handler in PermissionsHandler is null. It's probably done in this fashion to avoid adding softdepends on every Vault-based permission plugin.
Two possible solutions:

From the event, check if the plugin is a known one that supports contexts.
Schedule a task to register contexts on the first server tick.

I don't particularly like either solution, but it doesn't seem like Bukkit has any event that gets called after all plugins are loaded. Maybe something else works too, but this is what comes to mind. Any opinions?
replies.author: pop4959

replies.bodyText: So I got another idea from Glare (on Discord) that I like slightly better, which is a spin-off of my first solution. Instead of checking from this event, we do actually do it in onEnable, since after we've checked that a context supporting permission plugin is loaded, it should be safe to register the contexts since Essentials has a softdepend on it, and thus checkPermissions has to have run already and have a non-null handler.
replies.author: pop4959

replies.bodyText:
You're also already storing a
private Set<ContextCalculator<Player>> contextCalculators
Wouldn't be the biggest change to make that a Map<String, ContextCalculator<Player>> and just check to see if already registered - just an idea.
However, I'd suggest re-thinking whether that logic really needs to be running every time a plugin enables in the first place...
replies.author: lucko
lucko

replies.bodyText:
These should only be re-applied when the currently active permissions handler changes.
I'm not sure how I feel about registering these here - I'd personally have put them in a separate method or even a new class, as the amount of contexts will likely increase and it feels cluttered to throw them in here. Perhaps they could be added to a default registerContexts method on PermissionHandler?
replies.author: mdcfe

replies.bodyText: Yeah, it wasn't my intention to leave the registrations there either. It was just an easy place to put them for now while testing everything. They can be registered from anywhere though, whether that's primarily in onEnable, or a registerContexts method. For the latter, we probably want to consider if all contexts will always be enabled all at once, or if there are contexts which may need to be initialized elsewhere (because the calculator function needs to be defined in scope of whatever it's using, although most of the time that would probably be the Essentials instance).
replies.author: pop4959

timeline.message: Change context registrations only when the active permission handler changes
